Context:
Program Name: Business Administration – Project Management
Code: B156
Credential: Ontario College Advanced Diploma
Duration: 3 years (6 semesters in-class, 2 semesters work experience)
Method of Study: Full-time
Starting Months: January, September
Locations: St. James Campus
Program Type: Business Administration – Project Management (with work experience)
Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Students: $3,776.00 * per semester
- International Students: $17,925.00 ** per semester
Program Description: A three-year advanced diploma program that teaches project management skills including scope and change management, project control, risk management, team motivation, goal setting, project management tools usage, etc. with the added benefit of two semesters of real-world work experience.
Availability: Fall 2024, Winter 2025 (Open for applications)
Related Programs: Project Management (Postgraduate) (B415), International Business Management (Postgraduate) (B411)

* Domestic tuition fee might be subject to change.
** International tuition fee is for one academic year.

Context:
The text discusses a project management program (B156) offered at the Centre for Business within the School of Management at George Brown College. This program is accredited by ACBSP and offers work experience as a requirement for graduation, which can be co-op or internship. The program covers project planning, managing trade-offs, financial skills, collaboration, and diversity. The text also mentions that George Brown has earned recognition from ACBSP for fourteen of its business programs, including Advanced diploma and diploma programs in Accounting and Finance, Human Resources, Management, Marketing, and the Honours Bachelor of Commerce (Financial Services) program.

Additionally, the text provides information about field education opportunities with real-world challenges and clients and career options for graduates, such as assistant project manager, junior project manager/coordinator, project manager, project coordinator, and business project manager. George Brown College is a Global Registered Education Provider with PMI. The program does not require work experience for application, applicants should apply to B126 instead.

FACTUAL INFORMATION:
- Program Name: Business Administration – Project Management (B156)
- School: Centre for Business, School of Management
- Accreditation: ACBSP
- Work Experience Requirement: Two semesters (co-op or internship)
- Field Education Opportunities: Real-world challenges and clients
- Career Options: Assistant project manager, junior project manager/coordinator, project manager, project coordinator, business project manager
- Accredited Programs: Advanced diploma and diploma programs in Accounting and Finance, Human Resources, Management, Marketing, Honours Bachelor of Commerce (Financial Services)
- College Recognition: Global Registered Education Provider with PMI.
- Application for without work experience: Apply to B126 instead.

Context:
The George Brown College is an education provider that has a partnership with the Project Management Institute (PMI). Graduates of any courses listed on PMI's Registered Education Provider portal will meet the education requirements to apply for the Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM) or Project Management Professional (PMP) certification.

The B156 program at George Brown College requires students to complete a total of 36 courses: 32 mandatory courses, 2 business electives, and 2 general education electives. Students may be required to take certain prerequisite courses such as COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication) or MATH 1027 (Business Math with Remediation), which do not count toward the 36 courses required for graduation and will incur additional charges.

Students must complete three general education courses from at least two of the following categories: Social Sciences, Arts and Humanities, or Science and Technology. Students are also required to make up any failed or dropped courses before they can graduate. Some make-up classes may be offered through Continuing Education during the day or in the evening, but students should check with the Business Office staff to ensure that these courses are equivalent to those taught in the full-time program and to check for availability.

Semester 1 of the program includes the following courses: BUS 1038 (Business Concepts I), COMM 2000 (Communicating Across Contexts), COMP 1010 (Business Computer Applications I), and HRM 100. No prerequisites are listed for these courses.

Context:
SEMESTER 1:
- Courses: COMP 1010 (Business Computer Applications I), HRM 1008 (Fundamentals of HR Management), MARK 1020 (Principles of Marketing I), MATH 1008 (Math for Business & Management I)
- Pre-requisite: NONE

SEMESTER 2:
- Courses: ECON 1031 (Microeconomics), BUS 1040 (Project Management), COMM 1034 (Professional Communications I), COMP 1115 (Business Computer Applications II), MATH 1095 (Math for Business & Management II)
- Pre-requisite: MATH 1008

SEMESTER 3:
- Courses: ACCT 1036 (Principles of Accounting), ECON 1032 (Macroeconomics), MGMT 4009 (Operations Management), STAT 1012 (Business Statistics)
- Pre-requisite: MATH 1008

SEMESTER 4:
- Courses: ACCT 2031 (Managerial Accounting), BUS 1041 (Small Business Management), BUS 1038, BUS 1044 (Business Law), MGMT 2047 (Schedule and Cost Management), STS 1037 (Career Planning & Development)
- Pre-requisite: ACCT 1036 for ACCT 2031 and BUS 1000 for Work Experience Prep Course (only applies to students taking the Work Experience Option B156), COMM 1007 and minimum GPA of 3.0

SEMESTER 5:
- Courses: MARK 1002 (Professional Selling), MGMT 1020 (Management Decision-Making), MGMT 4009 & COMP 1115, MGMT 1035 (Global Trade Assessment), MARK 1020, MGMT 2032 (Advanced Project Management Tools)
- Pre-requisite: MGMT 2044 and MGMT 2047 for MGMT 2032 and MGMT 2049, MGMT 4009 & COMP 1115 for Global Trade Assessment

SEMESTER 6:
- Courses: MGMT 3006 (Strategic Analysis), COMM
- Pre-requisite: NONE

No information related to program offered by the college.

Context:
Program: Business Administration – Project Management (B126/156)

Applicants may need to have grades higher than the minimum requirements stated.
Course exemptions can be found in the transfer guide.
English proficiency is necessary and requirements can be reviewed on the English proficiency page.
Information for international students, including country-specific admission requirements, can be found on the International Admissions page.

Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, and can contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions section for inquiries about admission requirements, deadlines, or the application process.

International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System and can contact international recruitment representatives specializing by country of origin for more information on the International Contact Us page.

Information sessions are held regularly and can be signed up for online. Inquiries about financial aid, including OSAP, bursaries, scholarships, and other financial inquiries, can be made to the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or by visiting the Financial Aid section.

For advice on program options and which program might be best suited for an applicant, appointments with Entry Advisors can be made by reviewing their frequently asked questions. For inquiries related to the Business Administration – Project Management program, contact the Centre for Business at business@georgebrown.ca or (416) 415-5000 ext. 2160.
